statements: SELECT * FROM energy_usage;
SELECT timestamp, energy_value FROM energy_usage;
SELECT energy_value, timestamp FROM energy_usage;
SELECT * FROM energy_usage WHERE energy_value > 100;
SELECT * FROM energy_usage WHERE timestamp BETWEEN '2022-01-01' AND '2022-01-31';
SELECT * FROM energy_usage ORDER BY timestamp DESC LIMIT 10
SELECT energy_value FROM energy_usage WHERE timestamp >= '2022-01-01'
SELECT timestamp, energy_value FROM energy_usage WHERE energy_value > 100 ORDER BY timestamp ASC
SELECT * FROM energy_usage WHERE timestamp BETWEEN '2022-01-01' AND '2022-02-01'
SELECT AVG(energy_value) AS avg_energy_value FROM energy_usage
SELECT * FROM energy_usage;
SELECT date, forecast FROM energy_usage;
SELECT location, infrastructure_id FROM infrastructure;
SELECT usage, forecast FROM energy_usage WHERE date = '2022-05-15';
SELECT * FROM infrastructure WHERE upgrade_date <= '2021-12-31';
SELECT * FROM energy_usage ORDER BY date DESC;
SELECT location, MAX(usage) FROM energy_usage JOIN infrastructure ON energy_usage.date = infrastructure.upgrade_date GROUP BY location;
SELECT AVG(usage) AS average_usage, AVG(forecast) AS average_forecast FROM energy_usage;
SELECT * FROM infrastructure WHERE infrastructure_id IN (1, 3, 5);
SELECT location, COUNT(*) AS total_entries FROM infrastructure GROUP BY location HAVING COUNT(*) > 1;
SELECT * FROM energy_consumption;
SELECT customer_id, energy_usage FROM energy_consumption WHERE customer_id = 1001;
SELECT plan_id, plan_name FROM infrastructure_plans ORDER BY plan_name ASC;
SELECT MAX(energy_usage) AS max_energy_usage FROM energy_consumption;
SELECT forecast_id, date, forecasted_demand FROM demand_forecast WHERE forecasted_demand > 1000 ORDER BY date DESC;
SELECT * FROM energy_consumption ORDER BY date DESC WHERE energy_usage > 100
SELECT customer_id, SUM(energy_usage) FROM energy_consumption GROUP BY customer_id HAVING SUM(energy_usage) > 500
SELECT customer_id, date, energy_usage FROM energy_consumption WHERE energy_usage BETWEEN 50 AND 100 ORDER BY customer_id, date DESC
SELECT plan_name, COUNT(plan_id) FROM infrastructure_plans GROUP BY plan_name ORDER BY COUNT(plan_id) DESC
SELECT forecast_id, date, forecasted_demand FROM demand_forecast WHERE forecast_id IN (1,2,3)
SELECT * FROM energy_usage;
SELECT customer_name, customer_address FROM customer_information WHERE customer_id = 123;
SELECT timestamp, energy_value FROM energy_usage ORDER BY timestamp DESC;
SELECT forecast_date, forecast_value FROM demand_forecast WHERE forecast_value > 100;
SELECT upgrade_id, upgrade_description FROM infrastructure_upgrades ORDER BY upgrade_id ASC;
SELECT * FROM energy_usage WHERE customer_id = 1 AND energy_value > 100 ORDER BY timestamp DESC;
SELECT customer_id, MAX(energy_value) AS max_energy FROM energy_usage GROUP BY customer_id HAVING max_energy > 200 ORDER BY max_energy DESC;
SELECT e.timestamp, c.customer_name, e.energy_value FROM energy_usage e JOIN customer_information c ON e.customer_id = c.customer_id WHERE e.energy_value BETWEEN 50 AND 200 ORDER BY e.timestamp;
SELECT * FROM demand_forecast WHERE forecast_date > '2022-01-01' ORDER BY forecast_value ASC;
SELECT i.upgrade_description, COUNT(*) AS num_upgrades FROM infrastructure_upgrades i GROUP BY i.upgrade_description HAVING num_upgrades > 1 ORDER BY num_upgrades DESC;
SELECT * FROM energy_consumption;
SELECT households, commercial_buildings FROM energy_consumption;
SELECT timestamp, peak_demand, min_demand FROM energy_demand;
SELECT * FROM energy_production ORDER BY timestamp DESC;
SELECT solar_panels, wind_turbines FROM energy_production WHERE wind_turbines > 100;
SELECT * FROM energy_consumption ORDER BY timestamp DESC LIMIT 10
SELECT households, commercial_buildings, industrial_buildings FROM energy_consumption WHERE timestamp >= '2022-01-01' ORDER BY timestamp ASC
SELECT timestamp, peak_demand FROM energy_demand WHERE peak_demand > 1000 ORDER BY peak_demand DESC
SELECT * FROM infrastructure WHERE grid_lines > 50 ORDER BY grid_lines DESC, timestamp ASC
SELECT temperature, humidity FROM weather_data WHERE temperature > 30 AND humidity < 0.5 ORDER BY timestamp DESC
